abstract: Amazon is controlling ever-growing share of United States retail sales, accounting for 51 cents of every $1 spent online for items in 2015; company is capturing $22 billion, or almost 25 percent, of $94 billion growth in retail for year; shipped 200 million items over holiday season through its Prime subscription service; profits are still small.
lead_paragraph: Amazon capped its blockbuster year by reporting what it said was a record-breaking holiday season, shipping 200 million items through its Prime subscription service.

headline.main: It’s Amazon and Also-Rans in Retailers’ Race for Online Sales
headline.print_headline: In Online Race, It’s Amazon and Also-Rans

snippet: Amazon capped its blockbuster year by reporting what it said was a record-breaking holiday season, shipping 200 million items through its Prime subscription service.
